data.text: @thedailybeast Aretha Franklin was great-but @MariahCarey mopped the floor with her and the rest vocally with a vocal royal flush.  Mariah is 👑 and the rest are great singers in second place.  Mariah one upped the competition as well by composing almost all her material.

@RemeePooh @LarryBlaze6 @JCali1967 @EsqChoir @thedailybeast "Purposely"? Only because they couldn't keep up with Aretha like Celine could. It's not about "overshadowing". It's about singing with her, as she asked them to. That's what musicians do.

@LarryBlaze6 @JCali1967 @EsqChoir @thedailybeast It wasn't  a competition.  Many of the singers that night, aside from Celine,  purposely took a backseat and was mindful not to try and overshadow Aretha. It was her night and they didn't try to compete with her. So, the title of the article is indeed wrong.

@turbulentbeauty If i remember she did get a bit full of herself then...but that wus the era of bold n in ur face..but if i remember it wus somewhat in response 2 her being overlooked 4 the new candy..i will concede that but its music n it wus competition
@turbulentbeauty @thedailybeast It wus a moment..that moment stuck in many people's memory..funny i had 4gotten about it..but i dont c the harm..please enlighten me😯😯

@JCali1967 @EsqChoir @thedailybeast It wus a competition..n its music..thats the nature of competition..i understand ur point..but she wanted 2 show who the queen wus n many who watched wanted 2 c..thats the nature of the music biz..Sanatra did it 2 Harry Connick jr n so on
@JCali1967 @EsqChoir @thedailybeast Exactly wut is the offensive language..mind u..i am not arguing against ur feelings about this..just a conversation😎
@JCali1967 @thedailybeast @LarryBlaze6 It's literally a thing. Carole King talks about it in the article. Can't be offended by the truth.
@JCali1967 @thedailybeast I don't kno y u would feel that way..she did handle her biz..i remember this 4 the most part..it wus a battle of sorts n she handled it..thats that
@thedailybeast Aretha earned the love of milions! She was humble and was the "Queen of Soul" her legacy will last throughout time! God bless her! She meant so much to the masses
@thedailybeast Regina autem mortuus est, vivat Regina.  RIP Aretha Louise Franklin. 😟
